uk.ac.man.cs.mig.util.graph.controller

Interface VisualisedObjectManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventListener, PropertyChangeListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultVisualisedObjectManager

    public interface VisualisedObjectManager
extends PropertyChangeListener
    User: matthewhorridge The Univeristy Of Manchester Medical Informatics Group Date: Dec 27, 2003 matthew.horridge@cs.man.ac.uk www.cs.man.ac.uk/~horridgm The visualised object manager is associated with a graph model, and is responsible for keeping track of displayed/visualised objects from the graph model, and whether or not their parents/children are shown. Listeners may attach themselves to the visualised object manager in order to be informed when the visualised graph changes.

    • Method Detail

      • getGraphModel

        GraphModel getGraphModel()
        Gets the GraphModel that the visualised object manager is responsible for.
        Returns:
        The GraphModel that the visualised object manager holds on to.

      • setGraphModel

        void setGraphModel(GraphModel model)
        Sets the GraphModel that the VisualisedObject manager is responsible for.
        Parameters:
        model - The GraphModel to use.

      • showObject

        void showObject(Object obj)
        Specifies that the object should be visible in a visualisation of the graph model.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be made visisible

      • showObject

        void showObject(Object obj,
                int parentChildRadius,
                Class objClass)
        Specifies that the object should be visible in a visualisation of the graph model.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be made visible.
        parentChildRadius - The number of levels of parents and children to show. Note that a level of 0 is equivalent to the showObject(Object obj) method.
        objClass - Can be used to filter the type of objects to be shown.

      • hideObjects

        void hideObjects(Object obj,
                 int radius,
                 Class objClass)
        Hides objects that are past the specified radius.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object which the radius should be centred at.
        radius - The radius. Objects past this radius are hidden. For example, if a radius of 1 is specified, then grandchildren and grandparents would be hidden.
        objClass - Specifies the class of objects to remain visible.

      • showObjects

        void showObjects(Object[] objs)
        Requests that the specified objects be added to the visualisation.
        Parameters:
        objs - An array of objects to be added.

      • hideObject

        void hideObject(Object obj)
        Makes the specified object hidden (if visible) is a visualisation of the graph model.
        Parameters:
        obj -

      • showChildren

        void showChildren(Object obj,
                  Class objClass)
        Shows the children of the specified object.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object who's children are to be made visible
        objClass - Can be used to filter the type of objects to be shown.

      • showChildren

        void showChildren(Object obj,
                  int levels,
                  Class objClass)
        Shows the children of the specified object to the number of levels specified. For example, a level of 1 will show the immediate children, a level of 2 will show the immediate children, and their children, and so on.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object who's children are to be made visible
        levels - The number of child levels to show (>= 1).
        objClass - Can be used to filter the type of objects to be shown.

      • hideChildren

        void hideChildren(Object obj)
        Hides the children of the specified object.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object who's children are to be hidden

      • showParents

        void showParents(Object obj,
                 Class objClass)
        Shows the parents of the specified object.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object who's parents are to be made visible.
        objClass - Can be used to filter the type of objects to be shown.

      • showParents

        void showParents(Object obj,
                 int levels,
                 Class objClass)
        Shows the parents of the specified object to the number of levels specified. For example, a level of 1 will show the immediate parents, a level of 2 will show the immediate parents and their parents and so on.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object who's parents are to be shown.
        levels - The number of parent levels to show. (>= 1).
        objClass - Can be used to filter the type of objects to be shown.

      • hideParents

        void hideParents(Object obj)
        Hides the parents of the speicfied object.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object who's parents are to be hidden.

      • hideObjects

        void hideObjects(Object[] objs)
        Requests that the specified objects should be hidden/removed from the objects being visualised.
        Parameters:
        objs - The objects to hide.

      • hideAll

        void hideAll()
        Hides all currently visible objects.

      • getNumberOfVisualisedObjects

        int getNumberOfVisualisedObjects()
        Gets the number of objects contained in the list of objects to be visualised.
        Returns:
        The number of visualised objects.

      • getVisualisedObjects

        Object[] getVisualisedObjects()
        Gets all of the objects that are being visualised.
        Returns:
        An array of the visualised objects.

      • isShown

        boolean isShown(Object obj)
        Determines whether the sepcified object is in the list of object being visualised.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to test for.
        Returns:
        true if the object is in the list of objects to be visualised. false if the object is not in the list of objects to be visualised.

      • iterator

        Iterator iterator()
        Retrives an iterator, which can be used to traverse the list of visualised objects.
        Returns:
        The Iterator

      • getChildrenShownCount

        int getChildrenShownCount(Object obj)
        Determines how many children of the specified object are shown.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object
        Returns:
        The number of children shown, or -1 if the specified object is not being visualised.

        Parameters:
        obj - The object
        Returns:
        The number of parents shown, or -1 if the specified object is not being visualised.
